DummyFramework

1.2

Introduction

DummyFramework was created during my study at the university, in order to create Direct3D 9 based applications for homework, or just for fun. It provides an object-oriented environment to create games and demos, and by doing so it has a more friendly programming interface than DXUT.

Features

  • event handling through signal/slot system
  • content management
  • fixed timestep update
  • menu handling
  • font rendering using spritefonts
  • state management
  • shaders

  • WinAPI based GUI (experimental)
  • UDP based packet handling (epxerimental)
  • multithreading (experimental)

Licensing

The framework is free to use for non-commercial purposes. If you want to use it for that, then contact me first.
